properties.description: DORA establishes resilience standards for digital operations in the European Union (EU) financial sector. The regulation governs information and communication technology (ICT) risk, incident response, and third-party oversight.

metadata.displayName: Would you like to restrict specific IP addresses?
metadata.description: Select (Yes) to allow or forbid a list of IP addresses. If (No), the list of IP addresses won't have any effect in the policy enforcement

metadata.displayName: Allowed IP addresses
metadata.description: Array with allowed public IP addresses. An empty array is evaluated as to allow all IPs.

metadata.displayName: Forbidden IP addresses
metadata.description: Array with forbidden public IP addresses. An empty array is evaluated as there are no forbidden IP addresses.

metadata.displayName: Minimum TLS version
metadata.description: The minimum TLS protocol version that should be enabled. Windows machines with lower TLS versions will be marked as non-compliant.

metadata.displayName: Supported SKUs
metadata.description: The list of SKUs that support software-based double encryption

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and all folders
metadata.description: Specifies whether to make the Recovery Console SET command available, which allows setting of recovery console environment variables.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Location (Specify the location of the VMs that you want to protect)
metadata.description: Specify the location of the VMs that you want to protect. VMs should be backed up to a vault in the same location. For example - southeastasia.

metadata.displayName: Backup Policy (of type Azure VM from a vault in the location chosen above)
metadata.description: Specify the id of the Azure backup policy to configure backup of the virtual machines. The selected Azure backup policy should be of type Azure virtual machine. This policy needs to be in a vault that is present in the location chosen above. For example - /subscriptions/<SubscriptionId>/resourceGroups/<resourceGroupName>/providers/Microsoft.RecoveryServices/vaults/<VaultName>/backupPolicies/<BackupPolicyName>.

metadata.displayName: Exclusion Tag Name
metadata.description: Name of the tag to use for excluding VMs from the scope of this policy. This should be used along with the Exclusion Tag Value parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AppCentricVMBackupPolicy.

metadata.displayName: Exclusion Tag Values
metadata.description: Value of the tag to use for excluding VMs from the scope of this policy (in case of multiple values, use a comma-separated list). This should be used along with the Exclusion Tag Name parameter. Learn more at https://aka.ms/AppCentricVMBackupPolicy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Source
metadata.description: The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.

metadata.displayName: Warn
metadata.description: Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Namespace exclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.

metadata.displayName: Namespace inclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes label selector
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

metadata.displayName: Containers exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Image exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Status if Windows Defender is not available on machine
metadata.description: Windows Defender Exploit Guard is only available starting with Windows 10/Windows Server with update 1709. Setting this value to 'Non-Compliant' shows machines with older versions on which Windows Defender Exploit Guard is not available (such as Windows Server 2012 R2) as non-compliant. Setting this value to 'Compliant' shows these machines as compliant.

metadata.displayName: Profile name
metadata.description: The diagnostic settings profile name

metadata.displayName: Log Analytics workspace
metadata.description: Select Log Analytics workspace from dropdown list. If this workspace is outside of the scope of the assignment you must manually grant 'Log Analytics Contributor' permissions (or similar) to the policy assignment's principal ID.

metadata.displayName: Enable metrics
metadata.description: Whether to enable metrics stream to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: Enable logs
metadata.description: Whether to enable logs stream to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: Setting name
metadata.description: Name of the diagnostic settings.

metadata.displayName: Log Analytics workspace
metadata.description: Select the Log Analytics workspace from dropdown list

metadata.displayName: QueryStoreRuntimeStatistics - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream QueryStoreRuntimeStatistics logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: QueryStoreWaitStatistics - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream QueryStoreWaitStatistics logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: Errors - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream Errors logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: DatabaseWaitStatistics - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream DatabaseWaitStatistics logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: Blocks - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream Blocks logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: SQLInsights - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream SQLInsights logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: SQLSecurityAuditEvents - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream SQLSecurityAuditEvents logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: Timeouts - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream Timeouts logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: AutomaticTuning - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream AutomaticTuning logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: Deadlocks - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream Deadlocks logs to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: Basic (metric) - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream Basic metrics to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: InstanceAndAppAdvanced (metric) - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream InstanceAndAppAdvanced metrics to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: WorkloadManagement (metric) - Enabled
metadata.description: Whether to stream WorkloadManagement metrics to the Log Analytics workspace - True or False

metadata.displayName: Virtual Network Region
metadata.description: This Policy will review Vnets only in the selected region. You can create other assignments to include other regions.

metadata.displayName: Storage Account
metadata.description: The resource id of storage account where flowlogs will be sent to. It will be used for deployment purposes only. Make sure this storage account is located in the same region as the Vnet.

metadata.displayName: Network Watchers RG
metadata.description: The name of the resource group where the flowLog resources will be created. This will be used only if a deployment is required. This is the resource group where the Network Watchers are located.

metadata.displayName: Network Watcher
metadata.description: The resource id of the network watcher under which the flowLog resources will be created. Make sure it belongs to the same region as the Vnet.

metadata.displayName: Number of days to retain flowlogs
metadata.description: The number of days for which flowlog data will be retained in storage account. If you want to retain data forever and do not want to apply any retention policy, set retention (days) to 0.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
